FuncDef:
The port-mirroring observe-port group command enables the device to mirror packets to an observing port group.
The undo port-mirroring command disables the device from mirroring packets to an observing port group. The port-mirroring observe-port group command enables the device to mirror packets to an observing port group. The undo port-mirroring command disables the device from mirroring packets to an observing port group. By default, port mirroring is not configured on a port.
CLIs: port-mirroring observe-port group <group-id> { inbound | outbound | both }
undo port-mirroring [ observe-portgroup <group-id> ] { inbound | outbound | both }
ParentView: 100GE interface view,10GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an observing port group.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 8.

Assign mirror to the inbound of an interface.
-

Assign mirror to the outbound of an interface.
-

Assign mirror to both inbound and outbound of an interface.
-
